reviews.review: The biggest movie of this decade. People that didn't see this movie, they are missing out. You HAVE to see this atleast once, it's worth every penny you spend on that ticket. I left the theater shaking. I love this movie!!!
Marvel has had issues with villans in other movies but not this one thanos kills it.

I went into this expecting the villain to be aa compelling as the last decade of movies promised. Instead, he turned out to be as flimsy as possible. The drama feels forced and character arcs get consistently glossed over; who am I supposed to be focused on?

This movie brings a good sense of humor and sorrow in every scene and time. The reason I'm giving this 4 and a half stars is because there are confusing times in plotlines, though the MCU was trying to "keep it on the safe side" so that we can get to the peak of the story to learn more about the continuing story, but great movie Marvel!
Thoroughly entertaining. Not a single dull moment. Loved Thanos
Well it made me cry kinda but kinda gay if it has no sequel
It was a lot going so I want to see it again but first impression was good. Some nit picky complaints but over it's serviceable.
Best MCU movie of all time this is my favorite movie of all time well Russo's for an excellent movie hat was worth the wait.

Everything we were promised and more. Bold, well paced, and balanced - as all things should be. Spectacular visuals and actions, engaging dialogue, and a powerful emotional resonance beyond its status a a summer blockbuster. A movie that cannot be judged by traditional standards because it requires you to have done your homework - and if you've done it, the reward is great

This was the best parts of Marvel Studio flims from the past 10 years, tightly wound in one of the  best paced 2 1/2 hour film I've seen in a long time. It's also a roller coaster of emotion if you're really invested in the franchise. With such a crazy cliffhanger of a ending, it's going to be a long long looooooooong wait for Avengers 4.
